question: [File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions] [Interior mutability] Do any Storage variants use interior mutability (RefCell, Mutex) that could violate Rust's safety guarantees during concurrent access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Line 39: cfg(test)] [Testing features in production] Are all testing-only functions properly gated with #[cfg(any(test, feature = 'testing'))], or can dangerous functions leak into production builds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Function: reset_and_clear()] [Accidental production reset] Even with cfg gates, can the 'testing' feature flag be accidentally enabled in production, allowing catastrophic data loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Function: import_private_key()] [Testing key import in production] Is import_private_key() usage properly restricted to test code, or could it be called in production allowing backdoor key injection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions returning Result<_, Error>] [Error message leakage] Do error messages from Storage operations leak sensitive information like partial key material, internal paths, or cryptographic operation details? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions] [Error type confusion] Can Error variants from different storage backends be confused, causing incorrect error handling that leads to security vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions] [Panic vs Error] Are all failure cases properly handled with Result returns, or can some edge cases cause panics that crash validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Enum: Storage] [Uninitialized storage] Can Storage enum variants be created in an uninitialized or invalid state, allowing operations on uninitialized backends? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Enum: Storage] [Backend configuration tampering] Can attackers modify storage backend configuration (e.g., Vault endpoints, file paths) to redirect key operations to attacker-controlled storage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Function: available()] [Stale availability cache] Does available() cache results, and if so, can stale cache entries cause operations on unavailable storage leading to data loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions] [Memory zeroization] Are sensitive data structures (Ed25519PrivateKey, etc.) properly zeroized from memory after use, or can they be recovered from memory dumps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Box<Storage> usage] [Heap allocation of keys] Does storing private keys in heap-allocated Box structures increase attack surface for memory scraping attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions] [Resource exhaustion] Can attackers trigger excessive memory or storage allocation by repeatedly calling create_key() or set() with large payloads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Function: sign<T: CryptoHash + Serialize>()] [Trait bound bypass] Can attackers craft types that satisfy CryptoHash + Serialize bounds but have malicious implementations that compromise signature security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Function: get<T: DeserializeOwned>()] [DeserializeOwned trait exploitation] Can malicious DeserializeOwned implementations be exploited to execute arbitrary code during key retrieval? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All generic functions] [Monomorphization bloat] Can excessive monomorphization of generic functions cause code bloat that degrades performance in consensus-critical paths? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Functions: sign() and sign_using_version()] [Signature scheme confusion] Can mixing sign() and sign_using_version() calls on the same key lead to signature scheme confusion or protocol-level vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Functions: get_public_key() and get_public_key_previous_version()] [Public key consistency] Is there guaranteed consistency between current and previous public keys, or can race conditions cause them to become inconsistent? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All CryptoStorage functions] [Cryptographic domain separation] Do different cryptographic operations use proper domain separation to prevent cross-protocol attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Function: set()] [Key name validation] Are key names validated to prevent injection attacks, or can special characters in key names cause security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions] [Empty key name handling] What happens if empty string '' is passed as a key name - does it fail safely or cause unexpected behavior? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [All functions] [Very long key names] Are there length limits on key names, or can extremely long names cause buffer overflows or DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_key()] [Duplicate key creation] If create_key() is called twice with the same name, what is the behavior - does it fail, overwrite, or create a new version? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/storage/src/storage.rs] [Enum: Storage] [Backend-specific vulnerabilities] Do all storage backend implementations have equivalent security properties, or can attackers exploit weaker backends? (High)
